Package xxl.core.math.functions

The package xxl.core.math.functions contains necessary classes and interfaces to work with real-valued functions.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Differentiable
    Classes implementing this interface are either analytically or numerically differentiable, i.e., the first derivative or an approximation of it can be computed by calling the method derivative.
    Integrable
    Classes implementing this interface are either analytically or numerically integrable, i.e., the primitive or an approximation of it can be computed by calling the method primitive.
    RealFunction
    This interface models a mathematical real-valued, one-dimensional function.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractRealFunctionFunction
    This class provides a skeletal implementation for classes extending Function and also implementing RealFunction.
    AdaptiveAggregationFunction
    This class provides an adaptive online aggregation strategy by performing a convex merging of two objects.
    AdaptiveWeightFunctions
    This class provides some RealFunctions realizing different weighting strategies for an adaptive online aggregation.
    AdaptiveWeightFunctions.ArithmeticWeights
    This class provides an arithmetic weighting, i.e., equal weights in every step.
    AdaptiveWeightFunctions.GeometricWeights
    This class provides a geometric weighting, i.e., in each step the same weight alpha respectively (1-alpha) is assigned.
    AdaptiveWeightFunctions.LogarithmicWeights
    This class provides a logarithm weighting.
    AdaptiveWeightFunctions.ProgressiveDegressiveWeights
    This class provides a progressive respectively degressive weighting with a parameter alpha.
    AggregationFunction<P,A>
    An aggregation-function is a binary function that computes an aggregate.
    AggregationFunctionFunction<A,P extends A>
    This class wraps an aggregation-function to a normal function.
    CountingAggregationFunction<P,A>  
    DecoratorAggregationFunction<P,A>
    A decorator-aggregation-function decorates (wraps) an aggregation-function by passing given arguments to the invoke method of the wrapped aggregation-function.
    DistinctAggregationFunction<P,A>
    This class realizes an aggregation-function performing an early duplicate elimination during an aggregate operation.
    DistinctMetaDataAggregationFunction<P,A,M>
    This class realizes a metadata aggregation-function performing an early duplicate elimination during an aggregate operation.
    FunctionAggregationFunction<T,P extends T,A extends T>
    This class wraps afunction to an aggregation-function.
    FunctionRealFunction
    This class provides a wrapper for objects of type Function working with numerical data for using them as a real-valued function.
    LinearCombination
    This class provides a linear combination of two given RealFunctions as a RealFunction.
    MetaDataAggregationFunction<P,A,M>
    Decorates a given aggregation function with metadata information.
    RealFunctionArea
    This class wraps a RealFunction implementing Integrable in order to compute the area 'under' a given interval of the function.
    RealFunctionFunction
    This class provides a wrapper for objects of type RealFunction for using them as Function.
    RealFunctions
    This class provides some static methods useful for working with RealFunctions.
    SplineCompressedFunctionAggregateFunction
    This class provides a compression algorithm based upon the approximation of real-valued one-dimensional functions by a cubic Bezier-Spline interpolate used as an aggregation function for online aggregation of given numerical data without any error control.
    StatelessAggregationFunction<P,A,R>  

Package xxl.core.math.functions Description

The package xxl.core.math.functions contains necessary classes and interfaces to work with real-valued functions. Besides a general modelling of a real-valued function also the derivative and the primitive are emulated. In order to be interchangeable several wrapper for real-valued functions are available.
Picking up the idea of online aggregation, classes are provided that compute running aggregates of an arbitrary figure based on user-defined functions. This also includes spline compressed aggregate functions that only consume a fixed amount of memory.
